Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.check

Class Check

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.check.Check
public final class Check extends Object
Facilitates precondition and postcondition checking. See the package description for a detailed explanation.

      public static <X extends Exception> IntCheck<X> on(Function<String,X> excFactory, int arg)
      Static factory method. Returns a new Check instance suitable for testing integers.
      Type Parameters:
      X - The type of Exception thrown if the argument fails to pass a test
      Parameters:
      excFactory - A Function that will produce the exception if a test fails. The Function will be passed a String (the error message) and must return the Exception to be thrown
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      A Check object suitable for testing int arguments

    • offsetLength

      public static int offsetLength(byte[] array, int offset, int length)
      Verifies that offset + length is not greater than the size of the specified array and that offset is not negative and not greater than the length of the specified array. If any of these requirements do not apply, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Returns off + len (i.e. the toIndex). A null check is executed on the string argument first.
      Parameters:
      array - The array
      offset - The offset within the array
      length - The length of the segment
      Returns:
      The toIndex of the segment
      See Also:
      • offsetLength(int, int, int)

    • offsetLength

      public static int offsetLength(List<?> list, int offset, int length)
      Verifies that offset + length is not greater than the size of the specified list and that offset is not negative and not greater than the length of the specified list. If any of these requirements do not apply, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Returns off + len (i.e. the toIndex). A null check is executed on the string argument first.
      Parameters:
      list - The list
      offset - The offset within the list
      length - The length of the segment
      Returns:
      The toIndex of the segment
      See Also:
      • offsetLength(int, int, int)

    • offsetLength

      public static int offsetLength(String string, int offset, int length)
      Verifies that offset + length is not greater than the size of the specified string and that offset is not negative and not greater than the length of the specified string. If any of these requirements do not apply, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Returns off + len (i.e. the toIndex). A null check is executed on the string argument first.
      Parameters:
      string - The string
      offset - The offset within the string
      length - The length of the segment
      Returns:
      The toIndex of the segment
      See Also:
      • offsetLength(int, int, int)

    • offsetLength

      public static int offsetLength(int size, int offset, int length)
      Verifies that offset + length is not greater than the specified size and that offset is not negative and not greater than the specified size. If any of these requirements do not apply, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. Returns off + len (i.e. the toIndex). This check stands somewhat apart from the rest of the check framework: it tests multiple things at once, and it does not ask you to provide a Predicate or Relation implementing the tests. It is included for convenience and performance reasons, and because it is such a ubiquitous check.
      Parameters:
      size - The length of the array or array-like object from which to extract the segment
      offset - The offset of the segment
      length - The length of the segment
      Returns:
      The toIndex of the segment

    • fromTo

      public static int fromTo(List<?> list, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Checks that the specified list is not null and verifies that the specified from-index and to-index are valid given the list. Returns toIndex - fromIndex (i.e. the size of the list). Note that custom has it that both the from-index and the to-index are allowed to be one position past last element of the list (i.e. they are both allowed to be list.size()).
      Parameters:
      list - The list
      fromIndex - The start index of the sublist
      toIndex - The end index of the sublist
      Returns:
      the size of the sublist
      See Also:
      • fromTo(int, int, int)
      • List.subList(int, int)

    • fromTo

      public static int fromTo(String string, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Checks that the specified string is not null and verifies that the specified from-index and to-index are valid given the string. Returns toIndex - fromIndex (i.e. the length of the string). Note that custom has it that both the from-index and the to-index are allowed to be one position past last character of the string (i.e. they are both allowed to be string.length()).
      Parameters:
      string - The string
      fromIndex - The start index of the substring
      toIndex - The end index of the substring
      Returns:
      the length of the substring
      See Also:
      • fromTo(int, int, int)
      • String.substring(int, int)

    • fromTo

      public static int fromTo(int size, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Verifies that the specified from-index and to-index are valid given the specified size (supposedly of an array or array-like object). Returns toIndex - fromIndex (i.e. the length of the segment). This check stands somewhat apart from the rest of the check framework: it tests multiple things at once, and it does not ask you to provide a Predicate or Relation implementing the tests. It is included for convenience and performance reasons, and because it is such a ubiquitous check.
      Parameters:
      size - The size (or length) of the array, string, list, etc.
      fromIndex - The start index of the segment
      toIndex - The end index of the segment
      Returns:
      the length of the segment

    • fail

      public static <U> U fail(String msg, Object... msgArgs)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException with the specified message and message arguments. The method is still declared to return a value of type <U> so it can be used as the expression for a return statement.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the object that would have been returned if it had passed the checks
      Parameters:
      msg - The message
      msgArgs - The message argument
      Returns:
      Nothing, but allows fail to be used as the expression in a return statement

    • fail

      public static <U, X extends Exception> U fail(Function<String,X> excFactory) throws X
      Throws the exception created by the specified exception factory.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the object that would have been returned if it had passed the checks
      X - The type of the exception
      Parameters:
      excFactory - The exception supplier
      Returns:
      Nothing, but allows fail to be used as the expression in a return statement
      Throws:
      X - The exception that is thrown

    • fail

      public static <U, X extends Exception> U fail(Function<String,X> excFactory, String msg, Object... msgArgs) throws X
      Throws an exception created by the specified exception factory with the specified message and message arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the object that would have been returned if it had passed the checks
      X - The type of the exception
      Parameters:
      msg - The message
      msgArgs - The message argument
      Returns:
      Nothing, but allows fail to be used as the expression in a return statement
      Throws:
      X - The exception that is thrown
